page.title: 15ATTITUDES IN HOLTON-LE-CLAY
page.content: Early this year{boundary changes in {Lincolnshire}were considered. A group of children went to see a lady about {boundary changes in Holton-Le-Clay. She showed us many things like letters, lists of people who wanted to stay in{Lincolnshire}and maps of {Holton-Le-Clay}and near by{Humberston. She said that when they first found out about the{boundary changes}a {campaign committee}was set up. Letters were sent out to let the villagers know about the proposed changes and to let them know if they wanted to stay in{Lincolnshire.}The group has written to the{Boundary Commission,}to the {Prime Minister}and to their{local M.P. Finally the group won and {Holton-le-Clay}stayed in{Lincolnshire. The group still carries on with its work as boundaries will be reconsidered next year.
